And so these three lines meeting in one center, intimate that the most holy (being donor of euery good and perfect gift) ought to be magnified in his Sanctuarie for his sanctitie conferred vpon his Saints, whereby they shined as Philip. 1.1 •
lights in this heauen on earth, and now shine like D •• . 12.3. starres in heauen of heauen. For this end I haue begun, and I hope to finish an exposition of the Festiuall Epistles and Gospels vsed in our English Liturgie. The which (howsoeuer herein I may seeme bold) yet am I bound to dedicate vnto your Grace for many respectiue considerations, especially for this one, because your honourable disposition in the middest of a crooked nation is euermore to be both a patron and a paterne of vnfained sanctitie. Thus humbly beseeching the Lord to blesse, and your Grace to sauour these my labours; I rest
